interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: The Help
Review Date: 2019/07/19
Categories: Drama, Inspiring, Touching, Fun
Product Description: ['In 1960s Mississippi, Southern society girl Skeeter turns her small town on its ear when she interviews the black women who have spent their lives taking care of prominent white families.']
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Tate Taylor'], 'Producers': ['Michael Barnathan', 'Chris Columbus', 'Brunson Green', 'Nate Berkus', 'Jennifer Blum', 'L. Dean Jones Jr.', 'John Norris', 'Mark Radcliffe', 'Jeff Skoll', 'Tate Taylor'], 'Starring': ['Emma Stone', 'Viola Davis', 'Bryce Dallas Howard']}
Review Text: I have been late to the book and movie, but finally read the book and decided to watch the film.  The book was much better, but I loved the ladies in the film and all they brought to the story.
Review Title: Liked the Book's Details A Bit More
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Dr. Quinn Medicine Woman - The Complete Season One Helene Udy (Actor), James Leland Adams (Actor), Terrence O'Hara (Director), Michele Lee (Director) & 1 more Rated: Unrated Format: DVD Movies & TV, A&E Home Video, All A&E Titles ['Product Description', 'From the moment that Dr. Michaela "Mike" Quinn (Jane Seymour) first stepped from the stagecoach into the mud of Colorado Springs, TV audiences had a new destination on Saturday nights.', 'Dr. Quinn, Medicine Woman', 'won popular and critical acclaim--including five Emmy® awards--with its tales of courage, conviction and romance on the American frontier. When the show was cancelled after six seasons, it sparked one of the largest viewer protests in TV history.', "This comprehensive collector's set gathers all 17 episodes from the groundbreaking first season--plus a host of exclusive extras--on 5 DVDs. Old fans will delight in revisiting favorite moments, like Dr. Mike's first kiss from Sully (Joe Lando) and General Custer's visit to town, while newcomers will be captivated by the gripping, family-friendly stories and painstaking authenticity. Return to Colorado Springs for the unforgettable first season of Dr. Quinn, Medicine Woman, available for the first time on DVD!", 'Amazon.com', 'Season one of', 'Dr. Quinn, Medicine Woman', 'captures the popular television series at its most charming and original: a gently feminist, 19th-century Western with mythic overtones, a', 'Gunsmoke', '-like vision of small-town constancy, and an audacious love story that might best be described as Buckskin Bronte. British actress Jane Seymour scrubbed away her accent to play Michaela Quinn, fifth daughter of a well-to-do Boston physician who encouraged her to get a medical degree despite social obstacles.', "The headstrong Quinn moves to rough-and-tumble Colorado Springs to set up a practice, faces stiff resistance from the locals, witnesses the brutality of white America's expansionism, and generally experiences a classic Western transformation from privilege to pioneering. Along the way, Quinn makes a heartfelt connection with the mysterious Sully (Joe Lando), a laconic outsider/cowboy-knight-errant/widower preserving his broken heart. While the series' pilot may be the best thing in this set, there is a lot to enjoy about further episodes (with such guest stars as Johnny Cash and Robert Culp) exploring Quinn's hard-won admiration from town skeptics.", 'Dr. Quinn', 'creator Beth Sullivan admirably balances the many influences and narrative forces at work; some of the best shows are idea-driven, such as "Portraits," which deals with prejudice.', '--Tom Keogh'] {'Genre': 'Romance', 'Format': 'Box set, Color, NTSC, Full Screen', 'Contributor': "James Keach, Jerry Jameson, James Leland Adams, Michele Lee, Helene Udy, Alan J. Levi, Terrence O'Hara, Jerry London, Bethany Rooney, Chuck BowmanJames Keach, Jerry Jameson, James Leland Adams, Michele Lee, Helene Udy, Alan J. Levi, Terrence O'Hara, Jerry London, Bethany Rooney, Chuck Bowman See more", 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Stereo), Unqualified', 'Number Of Discs': '5', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 3 inches; 1.1 Pounds', 'Director': "Terrence O'Hara, Michele Lee, Chuck Bowman, Jerry Jameson, James Keach", 'Media Format': 'Box set, Color, NTSC, Full Screen', 'Run time': '14 hours', 'Release date': 'May 27, 2003', 'Actors': 'Helene Udy, James Leland Adams', 'Studio': 'A&E Home Video', 'Number of discs': '5'} I have always been a huge fan of Dr. Quinn from the moment in came on TV. I have many of the episodes taped, but as any avid "tapers" will notice, over the years they get fuzzy, jumpy, etc. I am so THRILLED that they have finally put these jewels on DVD! I love the clean storytelling, and I love the new twist on the old west story. Season One really starts the story line off with Dr. Mike and Sully, as well as shows Micheala's knack at being a mother. I can watch these shows a million times, and I'm crossing my fingers that they release the rest of the seasons! Mad about Medicine Woman! Becoming Jane Anne Hathaway (Actor), James McAvoy (Actor), Julian Jarrold (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG Format: DVD Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Miramax Home Entertainment, All Titles ['Anne Hathaway (The Devil Wears Prada, The Princess Diaries) gives a radiant performance as a young, love-struck Jane Austen in the witty and engaging romantic comedy Becoming Jane from Miramax Films. It s the untold romance that inspired the novels of one of the world s most celebrated authors. When the dashing Tom Lefroy (James McAvoy, The Last King Of Scotland), a reckless and penniless lawyer-to-be, enters Jane s life, he offends the emerging writer s sense and sensibility. Soon their clashing egos set off sparks that ignite a passionate romance and fuel Jane s dream of doing the unthinkable marrying for love. Becoming Jane, also starring the acclaimed Maggie Smith, James Cromwell and Julie Walters, is an enchanting and imaginative film you ll fall head over heels for'] {'Genre': 'Romance, Performing Arts', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Anne Hathaway, Julian Jarrold, James McAvoy', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Spanish (Dolby Digital 5.1), Unqualified, English (Dolby Digital 2.0)', 'Runtime': '2 hours', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.35:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Director': 'Julian Jarrold', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2 hours', 'Release date': 'February 12, 2008', 'Actors': 'Anne Hathaway, James McAvoy', 'Dubbed': 'Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish, French', 'Studio': 'Miramax', 'Number of discs': '1'} In this tale of Jane Austen's possible love of a man behind the scenes of the life we all know, we are shown a possible reason for the gut-wrenchingly romantic tales written by Ms. Austen. What we don't know, is the possible agony that might have led her to her tales of love.

This movie is beautiful and tragic all at the same time. I loved the movie, but found myself hopelessly sad for the rest of the evening. If you are single, please beware--this movie will leave you a little down, and not even a bowl of pasta can cure it's haunting message! I highly recommend this movie, but want any woman who is hopelessly in love with love to beware! You will most likely leave with cheeks wet, and eyes glistening with still to be shed tears. Just know what you're getting yourself into! Singletons--BEWARE Gilmore Girls: Season 7 Lauren Graham (Actor), Alexis Bledel (Actor) Rated: NR Format: DVD Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Warner Home Video, All Titles ['Product Description', 'Gilmore Girls: The Complete Seventh Season (DVD)', "As the Emmy®-winning series featuring a strong and loving mother-daughter relationship reaches its seventh and final season, Lorelai and Rory turn to each other for support. Will their relationships and dreams come to fruition? With a colorful cast of characters, life in Stars Hollow is anything but dull. As the season unfolds, Lorelai's relationship with Luke may be over now that she has let Christopher (recurring guest star David Sutcliffe), Rory's father, come between them again. Even so, Lorelai and Luke still have to coexist in tiny, close-knit Stars Hollow with the town's watchful eyes on them and their charged history. Meanwhile, Rory will attempt to keep her long-distance romance with Logan alive, even though communication has never been their strong suit, and London is far away. Rory now begins her senior year at Yale and continues as the editor of the Yale daily paper.", ']]>', 'Amazon.com', 'All good things must end, but not all good things end well.', 'Gilmore Girls', 'is one of the most original and entertaining television programs ever to grace the CW. Lorelai and Rory Gilmore (Lauren Graham and Alexis Bledel) star as the quick-witted and heavily caffeinated mother-daughter duo at the heart of this quirky drama. Normally smarter than the average show, the seventh season represents a slump in an otherwise brilliant run. The seventh season is the first without series creator Amy Sherman-Palladino, and her absence is evident. Smart characters make dumb decisions and dumb characters spend too much time on screen. The normally fluid plot slumbers along as Rory\'s father Christopher returns as Lorelai\'s love interest, Rory gets even more serious with Logan, while Luke and Lorelai try to repair their damaged relationship. But it\'s not all bleak. Highpoints of the season include the birth of Lane\'s twins, plus the long-awaited cameo by Christiane Amanpour, which sends Rory into a tizzy: "I can\'t meet Christiane Amanpour in my pajamas!" The counterbalance of the quirky Stars Hollowians, which is half the fun of', 'Gilmore Girls', 'in previous seasons, is gone or, worse, awkwardly shoehorned in. Still, for fans of the series the final season is a must-own, if only to find out what happens to the characters they loved and laughed with for so many years.', '--Megan Chaffee'] {'Genre': 'Drama', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Box set, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled', 'Contributor': 'Lauren Graham, Alexis Bledel', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Unqualified', 'Number Of Discs': '6', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.75 x 5.75 x 1.25 inches; 9.6 Ounces', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Box set, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled', 'Run time': '16 hours and 30 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 13, 2007', 'Actors': 'Lauren Graham, Alexis Bledel', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish, French', 'Studio': 'Warner Home Video', 'Number of discs': '6'} The Gilmore "girls" of Season 7 are full-grown women, with all the complications of life that this entails. While things changed during this season, and you can sense it over the first seven to eight episodes, things finally seem to settle in to give you the full range of these characters we've all come to love. As I watched the final episode, I felt content. In a way, I felt as though there was more to come for both Rory and Lorelai, but they were all good things. I guess you could say that even with things hanging a little, you knew these characters were just beginning a new chapter in their lives as well, and I was ready to wish them good luck! If you love previous seasons, you'll get into these sooner or later and feel part of Stars Hollow and the Gilmore lives once again. Ends Just Right Atonement James McAvoy (Actor), Keira Knightley (Actor), Joe Wright (Director) & 0 more Rated: R Format: DVD Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Universal Studios Home Entertainment, All Universal Studios Titles ['Product Description', 'From the award-winning director of Pride and Prejudice comes a stunning, critically acclaimed epic story of love. When a young girl catches her sister in a passionate embrace with a childhood friend, her jealousy drives her to tell a lie that will irrevocably change the course of all their lives forever. Academy Award nominee Keira Knightley and James McAvoy lead an all-star cast in the film critics are hailing "the year\'s best picture" (Thelma Adams, US Weekly).Bonus Content:', 'Deleted Scenes with Commentary by Director Joe Wright', 'Deleted Scenes with Commentary by Director Joe Wright', 'The Making of Atonement', 'The Making of Atonement', 'Novel to the Screen', 'Novel to the Screen', 'Feature Commentary with Director Joe Wright', 'Feature Commentary with Director Joe Wright', 'Amazon.com', 'Director Joe Wright (', 'Pride and Prejudice', ') gives Ian McEwan\x92s bestselling novel a sumptuous treatment for the screen that should come to be regarded as one of the defining films of the epic romantic drama. Indeed, everything about this film stems from those three words: there is little here that is not epic, romantic, and dramatic, and', 'Atonement', 'is a film that masterfully expresses the overarching sense of adventure and emotion that such stories are meant to convey. In this instance, the story centers around the love story of highborn Cecilia Tallis (Keira Knightley) and housekeeper\x92s son Robbie Turner (James McAvoy, in a star-making turn), in England shortly before World War II. Despite their class differences, they are powerfully attracted to each other, and just as their relationship begins Robbie is tragically forced away due to false accusations from Cecilia\x92s younger sister Briony (Saoirse Ronan). She has a crush on Robbie, too, and after reading a private letter he sent to Cecilia, and then witnessing the first expression of their mutual love but mistaking it for mistreatment, her resentment grows until it leads to her telling the lie that will send Robbie away. Soon World War II breaks out; Robbie enlists and is posted to France, Cecilia is a nurse in London, and Briony, now age 18 and aware of what she has done, tries to atone for her actions--but none of them will be able to get back what they have lost. Knightley and McAvoy are perfectly cast as the young star crossed lovers, and the young Ronan is particularly impressive, but it\x92s clear that the real star of this film is the director. Wright allows', 'Atonement', 'to revel in every moment of its story and each scene is compelling in its own way, but that now famous extended shot with Robbie on the beach at Dunkirk--filmed in one take and sure to be considered one of the great long tracking shots in film history--is the most memorable moment in this remarkable film.', 'Atonement', 'is an excellent example of what can happen when a great book meets great filmmaking. This is one that is not to be missed. --', 'Daniel Vancini', 'Stills from', 'Atonement', '(click for larger image).'] {'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.57 x 5.33 x 7.5 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Director': 'Joe Wright', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, Full Screen, NTSC, Subtitled', 'Run time': '2 hours and 3 minutes', 'Release date': 'March 18, 2008', 'Actors': 'James McAvoy, Keira Knightley, Romola Garai, Saoirse Ronan, Vanessa Redgrave', 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish, French', 'Producers': 'Tim Bevan, Eric Fellner, Paul Webster', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), French (Dolby Digital 5.1), Unqualified, Spanish (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Studio': 'Universal Studios Home Entertainment', 'Writers': 'Christopher Hampton', 'Number of discs': '1'} Having read Atonement in graduate school, I knew about the complicated issues that Ian McEwan's novel brings up and wondered how a movie would approach such issues in a sensitive, beautiful manner. The cinematography alone in this great movie sold me on the way that visual images captured the emotion behind the message. While Atonement, the movie, is about the tragic separation of two socially mismatched characters who fall in love (Keira's character is upper class, while James's character is the caretaker), the real message lies in the difficulty in explaining complicated, natural emotions and communication between mature adults. I think that the artistic representation of how natural, human sexuality develops between two consenting adults can be misconstrued by children who are not yet prepared for it. I think it is a reminder to us that while sexuality is natural and normal, that it is complicated and full of emotions that are much too complicated for children who are unable to process them.

This is a beautiful film, and one that I will readily say that I loved every bit as much as the novel! Brilliant Complication of Life Robin Hood: The Complete Series Jonas Armstrong (Actor), Richard Armitage (Actor), Alex Pillai (Director), Ciaran Donnelly (Director) & 1 more Rated: Unrated Format: DVD Movies & TV, BBC, All BBC Titles ['The complete series of the fantasy smash hit', 'Robin Hood', '--now in one gift set! The popular retelling of the Robin Hood legend is back with a hot young cast, and breathtaking archery, incredible swordplay, energy, humor, brute force, and the raw determination to right wrongs. Robin of Locksley returns from serving King Richard in the Crusades to find his home under the oppression of the sadistic Sheriff of Nottingham, and the Sheriff’s right hand man Guy of Gisborne has his eye on Robin’s childhood sweetheart Marian. Will Robin be able to save his people? Or will in justice overcome everything he stands for?'] {'Genre': 'Drama', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Color, Widescreen, Subtitled, NTSC', 'Contributor': "Toby Stevens, Joanne Froggatt, William Beck, Douglas Mackinnon, Richard Armitage, Jonas Armstrong, John Greening, Alex Pillai, Joe Armstrong, Gordon Kennedy, Graeme Harper, Clive Standen, Sam Troughton, Declan O'Dwyer, Anjali Jay, Lara Pulver, Lucy Griffiths, John McKay, Harry Lloyd, Holliday Grainger, Keith Allen, James Erskine, David Harewood, Ciaran Donnelly, Nicholas GleavesToby Stevens, Joanne Froggatt, William Beck, Douglas Mackinnon, Richard Armitage, Jonas Armstrong, John Greening, Alex Pillai, Joe Armstrong, Gordon Kennedy, Graeme Harper, Clive Standen, Sam Troughton, Declan O'Dwyer, Anjali Jay, Lara Pulver, Lucy Griffiths, John McKa… See more", 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Unqualified (DTS ES 6.1)', 'Runtime': '28 hours and 56 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.6 x 5.6 x 3 inches; 1.9 Pounds', 'Item model number': '7717970', 'Director': "Alex Pillai, Ciaran Donnelly, Declan O'Dwyer, Douglas Mackinnon, Graeme Harper", 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Color, Widescreen, Subtitled, NTSC', 'Run time': '28 hours and 56 minutes', 'Release date': 'September 14, 2010', 'Actors': 'Jonas Armstrong, Richard Armitage, Lucy Griffiths, Keith Allen, Sam Troughton', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'BBC Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '15'} As far as a series is concerned, if you are at all a fan of all things British, then this is a fun television series to watch. The acting is pretty good and the tension between Maid Marian and Robin Hood is keen in this series, which kept me watching! While it didn't feel as heavy handed and dark as some recreations of this tale, it still had plenty of action and fighting sequences, with a storyline that built on itself from episode to episode.

One side note. Guy Gisborne is played by Richard Armitage, the amazing and talented actor from the BBC production of North and South. His Guy Gisborne is so complex, dark, and brooding that you somehow manage to feel sorry for him a time or two. If you're a fan of Robin Hood or British television, I would give this series a try.

Packaging note: This came in a boxed set, but each season is individually included in the box. On the whole, it is a nice looking set that is user friendly and fits in with any other DVD collections you might own. Goyer, Russell Crowe, Michael Kelly, Deborah Snyder, Zack Snyder, Laurence Fishburne, Christopher Meloni, Harry LennixCharles Roven, Amy Adams, Christopher Nolan, Emma Thomas, Henry Cavill, Michael Shannon, Kevin Costner, Ayelet Zurer, Diane Lane, Richard Schiff, Antje Traue, David S. Goyer, Russell Crowe, Michael Kelly, Deborah Snyder, Zack Snyder, Laurence Fishburne, Christoph… See more', 'Initial release date': '2013-11-12', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Spanish (Dolby Digital 5.1), English (Dolby Digital 4.0), English (Dolby Digital 6.1 EX)', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.6 x 5.4 x 6.7 inches; 0.71 Ounces', 'Item model number': '230359', 'Director': 'Zack Snyder', 'Media Format': 'AC-3, Dolby, DTS Surround Sound, Blu-ray, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '143 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 12, 2013', 'Actors': 'Henry Cavill, Amy Adams, Michael Shannon, Kevin Costner, Diane Lane', 'Dubbed': 'Latin Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'French, Portuguese, Spanish', 'Producers': 'Charles Roven, Christopher Nolan, Emma Thomas, Deborah Snyder', 'Studio': 'Studio Distribution Services', 'Writers': 'David S. Goyer, Christopher Nolan', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '3'} Great extras came with the Blu-ray. I also used the download to put the movie on my iPad and other devices. I was happy with all that came with the movie, and the quality was excellent! Man of Steel Blu-Ray Star Trek Into Darkness Chris Pine (Actor), Zachary Quinto (Actor), J.J. Abrams (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG-13 Format: Blu-ray Movies & TV, Award Winners in Movies & TV, Oscar Central, Past Oscar Winners ['When the crew of the Enterprise is called back home, they find an unstoppable force of terror from within their own organization has detonated the fleet and everything it stands for, leaving our world in a state of crisis. With a personal score to settle, Captain Kirk leads a manhunt to a war-zone world to capture a one man weapon of mass destruction. As our heroes are propelled into an epic chess game of life and death, love will be challenged, friendships will be torn apart, and sacrifices must be made for the only family Kirk has left: his crew. The digital code works irrespective of the expiry date.'] {'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.6 x 5.4 x 6.7 inches; 10.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': '139863', 'Director': 'J.J. Abrams', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray, AC-3, Color, Dubbed, Dolby, Digital_copy, Widescreen, Subtitled', 'Run time': '2 hours and 12 minutes', 'Release date': 'September 10, 2013', 'Actors': 'Chris Pine, Zachary Quinto, Karl Urban, Zoe Saldana, Simon Pegg', 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish, Portuguese', 'Subtitles': 'English, French, Spanish, Portuguese', 'Studio': 'PARAMOUNT', 'Number of discs': '2'} The clarity on this Blu-ray is one of the best I have in my collection. The special features and extras are also amazing. I would always love more, but have to say that what I got with this purchase was more than I've received in some of my other recent film purchases, so I'm really happy with that. Star Trek Into Darkness Blu-Ray Digital Copy {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Producers': ["Lucilla D'Agostino", 'Caroline Self', 'Brandon Panaligan', 'Lauren Volonakis', 'Angela Shelley', 'Lexi Brown', 'Kyle Pettoni', 'Nick Prescott', 'Calvin Singh', 'Taylor Lucy Choi'], 'Starring': ['Caroline Manzo', 'Al Manzo', 'Albie Manzo'], 'Studio': ['Bravo']} I don't care what anyone says, I love them. Caroline has always been a straight shooter, and I love seeing what she and her family are up to! Great Housewife Family {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Andy Devonshire'], 'Producers': ['Anna Beattie', 'Mark Drake', 'Anna Driver', 'Hannah Griffiths', 'Jake Senior', 'Samantha Beddoes', 'Helen Cawley'], 'Starring': ['Mel Giedroyc', 'Sue Perkins', 'Mary Berry'], 'Studio': ['PBS']} As far as cooking shows go, this is top notch. This is more than a baking competition show, it is a cultural exhibition that has you walking into a pastry shop, bread shop, or good pub anywhere in the UK. In short, this show is a real joy to watch and I hope that all of the seasons become available for viewing AND purchase! Best of the Baking Shows Out There! {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Maura Corey'], 'Producers': ['Cameron Freeman', 'Adam Karpel', 'Sean Travis', 'Ciji Goodrich', 'Nathan Palmer', 'Jennifer Kaiser', 'Westley Harris', 'Michael Beck', 'Michelle Kongkasuwan'], 'Starring': ['Cary Deuber', 'Tiffany Hendra', 'Stephanie Hollman'], 'Studio': ['Bravo']} I somehow feel like we're going to be told, "Just kidding! This is a parody of the Housewives!" If only that were the case. I love this franchise, but this has to be the strangest bunch of women they've had on before. The backhanded squabbles and the silly, airheaded conversations have just about done me in. These Boots Were Made for Walking Away From This One... {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'Español', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Español', 'Français'], 'Directors': ['Stephen Frears'], 'Producers': ['Dan Winch'], 'Starring': ['Hugh Grant', 'Ben Whishaw', 'Alex Jennings'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']} More to this series than meets the eye. While it uses irony and sarcasm to deliver a message about rich, poor, gay, straight, decorum, politicians, artists, etc., the view of gay rights over the history of England in the 20th century was especially highlighted. There is a clear sense of honesty not rewarding one in the present, but definitely in the long run. Stick with it and it is a rewarding series. More Message to It Than Meets the Eye {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Scott Tankard'], 'Producers': ['Amanda Westwood', 'Kieran Smith', 'Anna Beattie'], 'Starring': ['Mary Berry', 'Paul Hollywood', 'Sue Perkins'], 'Studio': ['PBS']} I LOVE GBBO, so I own all of the seasons offered here in the U.S. This isn't my favorite group (I like season 1 and 3), but is still that quintessential British Baking that you love.

One warning though--the series finale has still not posted. That's not something to rate the show a low value, but I am still anxiously waiting for the finale to pop up so I can finish it. For some reason we're two weeks out and still nothing. Hopefully they post it with the season here soon. More Great British Baking Joy {'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Marielle Heller'], 'Producers': ['Anne Carey', 'Amy Nauiokas', 'David Yarnell'], 'Starring': ['Melissa McCarthy', 'Richard E. Grant'], 'Studio': ['20th Century Fox']} Melissa McCarthy is a treasure, as she can move from comedy to dramatic work so easily. This film is frustrating in so many ways, but I love the diverse characters we get and how easily McCarthy moves into this character. Seriously Sad Film {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Yorgos Lanthimos'], 'Producers': ['Ceci Dempsey', 'Ed Guiney', 'Lee Magiday', 'Yorgos Lanthimos'], 'Starring': ['Olivia Colman', 'Emma Stone', 'Rachel Weisz'], 'Studio': ['Searchlight']} The acting really was great in this film, but the characters were completely unlikable and the storyline bizarre. I love Oscar nominated films and historical dramas, but this one just missed the mark for me. Great Acting, Bizarre Story {'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'Français (Canada)', 'Español (España)', 'Italiano', 'Español (México)', '日本語', 'Deutsch', 'Français (France)'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Deutsch', 'Español', 'Français (Canada)', 'Français (France)', 'Italiano', 'Nederlands'], 'Directors': ['Bryan Singer'], 'Producers': ['Graham King', 'Jim Beach'], 'Starring': ['Rami Malek', 'Lucy Boynton', 'Gwilym Lee'], 'Studio': ['20th Century Fox']} What a film! I loved the music, the historiography, and the biography that is woven through the film. Rami Malek really is a genius in this film and helps us see directly through Freddie Mercury's point of view. This film is both entertaining and inspiring, so I highly recommend it to film buffs.
